result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mitchell R. Stoltz

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Mitchell R Stoltz in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak.  David Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 13CF384, 13CF385, 13CF386, 13CM314 (Sentencing) and 14CF307 (Status Conference).

1:05 p.m.  Court calls case and states the appearances.
Atty Knaapen makes statements on the 13CF307 case on the record.
The State would like to dismiss and read-in all of the charges on 14CF307.

BY THE COURT:
Charges on 14CF307 are DRI.

Court and counsel have received their copies of the PSI.
Court questions if any correction need to be made on the record.
Victim notification had been completed and no victim's appear at today's hearing.
Atty Knaapen has no corrections on the PSI.
Atty Krysak indicates his correction of the PSI on the record.
Prosecutor argues regarding sentencing.
Court makes statements to the parties regarding the bond posted by the defendant's aunt and that the aunt had written a letter requesting that her bond monies be returned to her.
Atty Kryshak had not received the copy of the letter written by the aunt and chooses not to receive a copy of this letter.
Court makes additional statements regarding the bond on the record.
Court questions Atty Knaapen as to why the warrant on 13CF386 had been vacated; Atty Knaapen makes statements on the record.
Atty Kryshak makes statements on the record as to why the defendant was removed from the aunt's home.
Attorney for Defendant argues regarding sentencing.
Defendant makes a statement on his behalf prior to his sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
**Sentencing**
13CF384:
Count 1 -
Impose/Stay 90 day jail sentence
24 months probation
Aoda Assessment and comply with treatment recommendations
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
Use one (1) pharmacy to obtain prescriptions and disclose to agent and sign releases  
Obtain GED if not already done so
Obtain and maintain full-time employment or be enrolled in and attend school full time, or a combination of both resulting in full time.
Pay court costs

13CF385:
Count 1 -
Impose/Stay 90 day jail sentence
24 months probation to run concurrent to 13CF384
Comply with conditions in 13CF384
Write letter of apology to the brother J.B.S.
No Contact with J.B.S unless allowed by the agent 
Pay court costs 

13CF386:
Count 1 - DRI
Count 2 -
Sentence withheld
24 months probation concurrent with other probations
Comply with all conditions set forth in the 13CF384 case
Conditional jail of 270 days
Jail Credit of 270 days
Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent
Pay restitution in the amount of $1,450.19 to David Worzalla, makes minimum payments of $50.00 to be paid within the 1st year of probation
Write letter of apology to David Worzalla to be reviewed by the agent
Pay Court costs - 10% restitution surcharge 
All monies collected for restitution should go to the victim's first 
Provide DNA sample
Pay DNA Surcharge
Obtain GED if not already done so
Obtain and maintain full-time employment or be enrolled in and attend school full time, or a combination of both resulting in full time.
Pay costs 
Comply with anger managment classes
Comply with cognitive intervention program and no violence or aggressive contact with anyone during supervision
No contact with Amber Osowski, Melissa MacDonald, Eric Lee, David Worzalla and Ian Rosebrook
No contact with Justin Schultz or Amber Horst unless approved by the agent. 
Expungement allowed if successfully completes probation
Count 3 -
Sentence withheld
24 months probation concurrent with count 2 and other probations
Comply with conditions in all other probations
Pay court costs
Count 4 - DRI

13CM314:
Count 1 - DRI
Count 2 -
Impose/Stay 90 day jail sentence - consecutive to any other sentence he may be serving 
24 months probation concurrent and comply with all conditions set forth in other files
Pay court costs
18 days jail credit
Serve 18 days in county jail
Count 3 - DRI
Count 4 - DRI
Count 5 - DRI

**Status Conference**
14CF307  ALL OF THESE CHARGES ARE DRI
Count 1 - 
Count 2 -
Count 3 -
Count 4 -
Pre-trial conference on September 23, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Mitchell R. Stoltz in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 23, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
Statement Regarding Recusal - Molepski, Jr/Judge Finn
Preliminary hearing on September 8, 2014 at 03:00 p.m.
Preliminary hearing on September 8, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Mitchell R. Stoltz in court with attorney William Drengler. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
Bond is continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 8, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
Law Intern Taylor Krause w/ADA Cousins appears for the State of Wisconsin and states the appearances of the parties.  Matter is adjourned.

comply with all open bonds on other cases
defendant to meet with his attorney

Clerk is Shelley P.
2:55 p.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states the appearances.
Atty Drury appears on behalf of the defendant.

ADA  Cousins appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA Cousins states facts for anticipated charges of Felony Bailjumping.  
Atty Drury makes statments regarding the charges; Atty Drengler is his Attorney but is not available at this time.
Atty Cousins makes further statements on the record.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court questions Defendant. 
State requests a $1,000.00 cash bond with conditions as stated.

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:  August 4, 2014 @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 1.
